author: Special Correspondent
text:
Anti-Corruption Bureau sleuths of the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) have caught a Syndicate Bank chief manager while he was allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs. 45,000 to release the housing loan sanctioned to a person. Based on a complaint, a team of officials raided the house of K.C. Mishra, a resident of Vijayanagar, on Thursday and recovered the bribe amount.

Mishra, who was working in the Peenya branch, is to retire next month. The officials also recovered Rs. 2 lakh that is yet to be accounted for along with 14 documents belonging to movable and immovable properties. Mishra was produced before the CBI special court on Friday and remanded in judicial custody till March 17. CBI sources said a case has been registered against Mishra based on the complaint lodged by N. Ashok of Vidyaranyapura. Ashok complained to the CBI that Mishra was demanding one per cent of the sanctioned loan amount as bribe.
title: Bank manager caught taking bribe for home loan
